content.title: Intro
content.content:
1990
Preceded by
1990
1991
Year
1992
Followed by
1992

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1991.

content.title: January
content.content:
4 - Actress Olivia Tennet is born.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 15 is published.

content.title: February
content.content:
9 - First official meeting of the Sociedad Tolkien Española.
15-18 - The first Colloquium on the Languages of Middle-earth starts at the house of E.L.F. member Bill Welden.
17 - Singer Ed Sheeran is born.

content.title: March
content.content:
9 - Norwegian translator Nils Werenskiold dies.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 16 is published.

content.title: April
content.content: 10 - The Atlas of Middle-earth, revised edition, is published.

content.title: July
content.content:
22 - Margaret Carroux, the translator of the first German The Lord of the Rings-translation, dies.
25 - Actor Brian Haines dies.
26-29 - Mythcon 22.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 18 is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
3 - Priscilla Tolkien speaks on "J.R.R. Tolkien: Scholar and Storyteller" at the Martin Luther King Memorial Library in Washington, D.C.
19 - Taum Santoski, who assisted Christopher Tolkien with The History of Middle-earth and wrote much of the base of The History of The Hobbit, dies of cancer at the age of 32.

content.title: September
content.content:
20-22 - Oxonmoot 1991.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 19 is published.
? - Mallorn 28 is published.

content.title: October
content.content: ? - Elendor, the oldest Multi-User Shared Hallucination (MUSH) server, is established.

content.title: November
content.content:
15 - After the King: Stories In Honor of J.R.R. Tolkien is published.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 20 is published.

? - J.R.R. Tolkien's secretary Joy Hill dies.
? - The Sociedad Tolkien Española is founded.
? - Tolkien - The Centenary Calendar 1992 is released.
? - The 1992 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar is released.
? - The Tolkien Diary 1992 is published.
Years
1988 1989 1990 1991 1992 1993 1994
